meanings.definition: To cause to occur or operate at the same time
meanings.sent1: The dancers synchronized their movements perfectly.
meanings.sent2: The music and lights were synchronized for the performance.
meanings.sent3: The synchronized clowns made everyone laugh at once.
meanings.sent4: Her heart and mind synchronized in a moment of clarity.
meanings.sent5: The synchronized swimmers moved like a single entity in the water.

meanings.definition: To coordinate in time or manner
meanings.sent1: They synchronized their schedules to meet for lunch.
meanings.sent2: The team synchronized their efforts to complete the project on time.
meanings.sent3: The synchronized chefs cooked a meal with perfect timing.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts and actions synchronized seamlessly.
meanings.sent5: The traffic lights synchronized to allow smooth traffic flow.

meanings.sent1: The synchronized fireworks lit up the night sky.
meanings.sent2: The thunder and lightning were synchronized during the storm.
meanings.sent3: The synchronized arrival of the guests surprised the host.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter and tears were synchronized, showing mixed emotions.
meanings.sent5: The synchronized clocks all struck noon together.
